chapter.para: This chapter gives an overview on how to run through a default installation of &productname; for the &amd64;/&intel64; architecture.

sect1.title: Installing &productname;
sect1.para: Use the following procedures to set up a new &productnamereg; &productnumber; cluster.

sect2.title: System Requirements
sect2.para: Before you begin the installation, please make sure your system meets all requirements listed below.

listitem.para: Any AMD64/Intel* EM64T processor (quad-core processors are recommended). 32-bit processors are not supported.
8 GB physical RAM per node.
40 GB available disk space (or more depending on the count and size of container images you intend to run).

sect3.title: Cluster Size Requirements
sect3.para: &productname; only functions in a clustered configuration. It requires a group of physical or virtual machines in order to operate. The minimum supported cluster size is four nodes: one &admin_node;, one &kmaster;, and two &kworker;s.

note.title: Test and Proof-of-Concept Clusters
note.para: It is possible to provision a three-node cluster with only a single &kworker;, but this is not a supported configuration for deployment.

sect3.title: Network Requirements

listitem.para: In order to communicate without interruptions, all nodes should be on the same network.
A DHCP server to dynamically provide IP addresses and host names for the nodes in your cluster (unless you configure all nodes statically).
A DNS server to resolve host names. Please make sure you have reliable DNS resolution at all times, especially in combination with DHCP.

important.title: Unique Host Names
important.para: Host names must be unique. It is recommended to let the DHCP server provide not only IP addresses but also host names of the cluster nodes.

listitem.para: In a &productname; cluster, internal TCP/IP ports are managed using iptables controlled by Salt and so need not be manually configured. However, for reference and for environments where there are existing security policies, the following are the standard ports in use.

sect3.para: When some additional ingress mechanism is used, additional ports would also be open.

listitem.para: &productname; &productnumber; does not support remote installations with Virtual Network Computing (VNC).

sect2.para: Use these instructions if there is no existing Linux system on your machine, or if you want to replace an existing Linux system.

important.para: Please make sure all nodes are on the same network and can communicate without interruptions. If you are using host names to specify nodes, please make sure you have reliable DNS resolution at all times, especially in combination with DHCP.

tip.title: Installing Product Patches at Installation Time
tip.para: If &productname; has been successfully registered at the &scc;, you are asked whether to install the latest available online updates during the installation. If choosing Yes, the system will be installed with the most current packages without having to apply the updates after installation. Activating this option is recommended.

step.para: After you have finalized the system configuration on the Installation Overview screen, click Install. Up to this point no changes have been made to your system. After you click Install a second time, the installation process starts.
During the installation, the progress is shown in detail on the Details tab.
After the installation routine has finished, the computer is rebooted into the installed system.

sect2.title: Initial Cluster Configuration
sect2.para: In order to finalize the configuration of the &admin_node;, a few additional steps are required.

step.para:
After the &admin_node; has finished booting and you see the login prompt, point a web browser to https://caasp-admin.&exampledomain;
, where caasp-admin.&exampledomain; is the host name or IP address of the &admin_node;. The IP address is shown above the login prompt.

To create an Administrator account, click Create an account and provide an e-mail address and a password. Confirm the password and click Create Admin. You will be logged into the dashboard automatically.
Fill in the values for Dashboard Location and External Kubernetes API server FQDN. If necessary, configure the Proxy Settings.

listitem.para: Host name or IP of the node running this web interface.
Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) used to reach the cluster from the outside. In a simple, single-master deployment this will be the FQDN of the node you are about to select as master.

If enabled, you can set proxy servers for HTTP and HTTPS. You may also configure exceptions and choose whether to apply the settings only to the container engine or to all processes running on the cluster nodes.

step.para: Click Next to proceed and install some cluster nodes as described in .

sect2.title: Installing Cluster Nodes
sect2.para: Cluster nodes can be installed manually or with &ay;. Manual installation is only feasible for a small number of workers. For larger numbers, &ay; is recommended.

You can directly use the initrd and linux files from your install media, or install the package tftpboot-installation-CAASP-1.0 on the TFTP server. The package provides the required initrd and linux files in the /srv/tftpboot/ directory. You need to modify the paths used in the &sle; 12 Deployment Guide to correctly point to the files provided by the package.
Before you can set up a cluster node, you have to install and bootstrap an &admin_node; to run the administration dashboard. Refer to for information on how to install the &admin_node;.

sect3.para: Please make sure you have finished the initial configuration described in before installing cluster nodes with &ay;.

step.para: Insert the &productname; DVD into the drive, then reboot the computer to start the installation program.
Select Installation on the boot screen. Enter the necessary Boot Options for &ay; and networking, namely:

Network configuration. If you are using dhcp, you can simply enter dhcp. For manual configurations, refer to .

step.para: Press . This boots the system and loads the &productname; installer.
The rest of the installation will run fully automated. After a reboot, the worker should show up in the dashboard and can be added to your cluster.

sect2.title: Bootstrapping the Cluster
sect2.para: To complete the installation of your &productname; cluster, it is necessary to bootstrap at least three additional nodes; those will be the Kubernetes Master and Workers.

step.para:
Point a web browser to https://caasp-admin.&exampledomain;
to open the dashboard, where caasp-admin.&exampledomain; is the host name or IP address of the &admin_node;.
The dashboard lists all cluster nodes registered at the &admin_node;. Newly installed nodes are be listed as Pending Nodes. You can accept individual nodes or all by clicking Accept All Nodes.

Use the check box in the first column to select the nodes you want to add to your cluster. In the last column, select the one that should become Kubernetes Master. All other nodes will be set to the Worker role once you click Bootstrap cluster.
Please wait while the cluster is bootstrapped. Once finished, the status indicator icon of the nodes changes accordingly and you can download the kubectl configuration file.
